caption: Beautiful church. I walked in to the smell of incense as mass had just finished on All Saints Day. Well decorated and welcoming church which is situated just behind The Pantheon. Beautiful stained glass windows. They were preparing for a March of witness. Definitely worth a visit and it’s free to enter.

A stunning church right next to the Pantheon, it is truly special. We were lucky enough to be there during the Sunday service—it was wonderful, and we enjoyed the hymns and the sound of the organ. A little funny story: if you visit the place and are looking for love, I read about a legend that says if you leave a small piece of paper at the remains of St. Genevieve, you’ll fall in love in Paris:)
Wonderful FREE attraction to visit. Arrived just after 9 and it was largely empty. Beautiful architecture and art.  Worth adding to your schedule when visiting the Pantheon

Another beautiful and very large church in the heart of Paris, like so many others I have visited there and reviewed here. As I have written before, I was amazed by the number, size and beauty of the churches in Paris, like in no other city I have visited in the world. Not in Italy, Spain, Austria or anywhere else. This is another beautiful example. Just look at the pictures.

I really like this church. Tucked away behind the Pantheon, most tourists miss it, and yet it is a real architectural gem (see, for example, the elaborate double staircase) AND it contains the remains of one of the most important patron saints of Paris, Saint Genevieve, who lived in the fifth century. Absolutely worth a visit.
Absolutely gorgeous church, the interior was breathtaking! The stained glass art, paintings and architecture were incredible. Very calming and peaceful.

Like many others, we found this church when walking from the Pantheon. It's a dimly lit cathedral, with candles lit on stands. It all adds to the atmosphere and makes for a great place to stop into while strolling around.
Hidden gem  One of the prettiest church in Paris  Totally worth it  Free and no waiting line :3

I came here when there was a massive storm raging through Paris and the flood gates were opened! People were rushing into the church like it was the end of the world, it was funny but also very atmospheric at the same time, a real opportunity to be there. The church its self is stunning, it’s very dark inside but this all leads to the charm and the sparse candle light. Highly recommended.
A beautiful structure that captivates with its grandeur both inside and out. Entry is free, and you can step inside to admire the architecture of that era. Highly recommend visiting!

Stumbled upon this church walking from the Pantheon. I love old churches so I had to see the inside. Spectacular. And it was the burial place of St. Genevieve. The stonework and stain glass windows were amazing.
worth a visit if you came for the pantheon since its right beside it. i loved the art and ambiance inside. just as beautiful as all the other churches of paris
It’s a beautiful church see video and photos. Free entrance.
Nice historical building and also sounds like a holy place due to a lot of prayer came in, really worth to visit. Nobody asked for ticket. No parking place or toilet available nearby.

With so many churches and cathedrals in Paris I feel it is hard for one to really stand out. Saint-Étienne-du-Mont certainly did manage to stand out for me. The style and detail of this church are amazing. We were on our way to the Pantheon when we found Rue Montagne Sainte-Geneviève and were stuck by the beauty. The outside stairs are recognizable from the Movie Midnight in Paris, where Owen Wilson goes each night to be transported back in time. The church alone is worth the visit to this beautiful area.
Attended Sunday Mass. The church is beautiful especially the rear chapel dedicated to the Blessed Virgin Mary. The choir was excellent.
Very nice Church XVI th century. The Pope, Saint John Paul II was here in 1997. praying on Saint Genevieves tomb

This is a delightful church building in the 5th District just behind the Pantheon at Place Sainte Genevieve. It is well worth making time to see before or after your visit to the Pantheon.  The church history dates back to the Abbey of St-Genevieve which was constructed nearby in the 6th century during the time of King Clovis I. The original Saint-Étienne church was constructed here in 1222. However, it had to be enlarged and reconstructed several times in later centuries.  The building you see now dates back to the the end of the 16th century. It is French Gothic and French Renaissance in architectural style and is quite beautiful. The exterior includes a decorative facade and single narrow tower.  Perhaps more impressive however is the interior of the church. What you'll find is a traditional Gothic nave with high vaulted ceiling, an impressive wooden pulpit, stained-glass windows, wall frescos as well as a charming rood loft with almost whimsical spiralling staircases on both sides. The side chapels are delicately decorated and also worth spending time to enjoy.  In the end, Saint-Étienne-du-Mont is an interesting church to learn about historically and to view if you plan to spend time in the 5th district on the Left Bank. You can easily combine a visit here with that of the Pantheon and Musee du Cluny which is also nearby.

Magnificent! The only thing you need to keep in mind is that the church does not always allow visitors or tourists, especially during their services and other activities. Therefore, in case you are unlucky, and in a hurry to visit it quickly, you might not be able to do so.  You will find the chapel of the famous mathematician Blaise Pascal inside the church.
Great church just near the pantheon.  Great design. Many great photo ops too. I spent longer in this church than I did at the Pantheon. Well worth checking out.

This wonderful church is across the road from the Pantheon. It contains the last remaining rood screen in Paris and one of the oldest organs in the capital. It is a hidden gem, which is well worth a visit.
I had been here once and did not realise that there was St Geneviève here.

During our family visit to Paris in October 2023, we had the opportunity to explore the Church of Saint-Étienne-du-Mont, and I would rate it four stars. Nestled next to the Panthéon, this church offers a captivating ambiance, enhanced by the glorious light filtering through its stunning stained glass windows. The play of light creates a truly magical atmosphere, adding to the allure of the place.  One of the remarkable aspects of the Church of Saint-Étienne-du-Mont is that admission is free, making it accessible to all visitors. This inclusivity allows everyone to experience the beauty and serenity of this historical gem without any barriers.  Overall, our visit to the Church of Saint-Étienne-du-Mont was a memorable experience, enriched by its breathtaking architecture and tranquil atmosphere. I would recommend it to anyone looking to explore the religious and cultural heritage of Paris.
Relaively "new" church compared to others, built in a mix of gothic and renaissance styles. Interesting but not up to its more famous peers nearby. Taking photos inside is forbidden!
Very beautiful church.
A very beautiful church and absolutely worth your time. In fact: Spend more time here than in the Pantheon, there are more to see.
When you go to France Paris you have to visit Saint Etienne very very beautiful Church You will see the art of architecture and pictures It worth to visit it
Yet another cathedral you can visit for free. Do not miss this if you're planning a trip to see the Pantheon. Its only steps from it.
My favorite cathedral and I've visited many all over the world. I love that some of the stone almost looks like lace.
Serene place, take a moment to breathe and cherish life and the moment you’re in.
What a beauty. One of the best looking churches in Paris.

Guide books will explain this church's coherent and beautiful architecture.    Its reputation is justified.  The rood screen (a structure intended to hide the celebration of the Mass in the chancel from parishioners in the nave) is the only one surviving in Paris, and it's most elegant.  Blaise Pascal and Racine are buried here.

This is one church I would go out of my way to visit in Paris, one of my favorites. Beautiful, architecture, interesting history. Close to the beautiful Luxembourg gardens and the Pantheon. It is home to the reliquary of the patron Saint of Paris, St. Geneviève. There are some unique historic features in the church you won't find in many others. One interesting side note, the large red door on the Eastern side of the church was featured in the movie "Midnight in Paris".

This church is a hidden gem in Paris. Absolutely spectacular and a lovely place to just sit and watch the world go buy. Those who have seen the Woody Allen movie "Midnight in Paris", will recognize the steps and street it was filmed from. Would highly recommend to visitors wanting to get a little bit away from the busy tourist areas.
Very beautiful Church. It's really worth it to visit

This church was spectacular. We visited many many cathedrals while in Europe over multiple weeks. This one stood out as surprisingly unique and beautiful. Entry is free, which is a surprise as they could charge for entry, as it’s very impressive. We stumbled into it as it is just around the corner from the Pantheon. I highly recommend visiting it. A hidden gem
One of the lovely parish churches of Paris - make sure you go to the back of the church to see the stunning stained glass windows (among the oldest in Paris)
Beautiful church, free to access. Do so respectfully, and enjoy the details.
